com.accele.gage

Class ResourceLocation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.accele.gage.ResourceLocation

  • public class ResourceLocation
extends java.lang.Object
    A class describing the location of a particular Resource. The default location of a Resource will be "/res/" if only the name is specified.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    William Garland

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_LOCATION 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ResourceLocation(java.lang.String name)
      Constructs a ResourceLocation with the specified name and "/res/" as the location.
      ResourceLocation(java.lang.String location, java.lang.String name)
      Constructs a ResourceLocation with the specified location and name.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getLocation()
      Returns the location (containing directory) of the Resource.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the Resource (typically the name of the file).
      java.nio.file.Path toPath()
      Converts this ResourceLocation to a Path.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the fully-qualified path of this ResourceLocation.

        public ResourceLocation(java.lang.String location,
                        java.lang.String name)
        Constructs a ResourceLocation with the specified location and name.
        Parameters:
        location - the location of the Resource (typically the directory of the file)
        name - the name of the Resource (typically the name of the file)

    • Method Detail

      • getLocation

        public java.lang.String getLocation()
        Returns the location (containing directory) of the Resource.
        Returns:
        the location of the Resource

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the Resource (typically the name of the file).
        Returns:
        the name of the Resource

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the fully-qualified path of this ResourceLocation. For example, if the location is "/assets/" and the name is "data.txt", then this method will return "/assets/data.txt".
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the fully-qualified path of this ResourceLocation

      • toPath

        public java.nio.file.Path toPath()
        Converts this ResourceLocation to a Path.
        Returns:
        the Path representation of this ResourceLocation
